Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red pottery cylindrical vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is encrusted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of at least two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, partly obscured by a dark-brown resinous deposit.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394799) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394799)
